meanings.definition: A surgical instrument used to control bleeding by clamping blood vessels.
meanings.sent1: The nurse used a hemostat to stop the bleeding after the surgery.
meanings.sent2: During the operation, the surgeon reached for the hemostat to clamp the blood vessel.
meanings.sent3: The hemostat decided to take matters into its own hands and stop the bleeding.
meanings.sent4: The hemostat was like a superhero, swooping in to save the day by clamping the blood vessel.
meanings.sent5: The shiny hemostat gleamed under the bright lights of the operating room as it clamped the blood vessel.

meanings.definition: A medical device used to prevent blood loss during surgery.
meanings.sent1: The hemostat was an essential tool in the surgeon's kit to prevent blood loss.
meanings.sent2: The doctor carefully applied the hemostat to ensure there was no excessive bleeding during the procedure.
meanings.sent3: The hemostat joked with the scalpel, saying, 'I'll handle the blood loss, you focus on the incision.'
meanings.sent4: In the hands of the skilled surgeon, the hemostat was a shield against blood loss during the operation.
meanings.sent5: The bright red blood contrasted sharply with the silver hemostat as it worked its magic to prevent any loss during surgery.
